message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the application of sparse representation-based classification (SRC) to machine learning, which is a topic commonly studied in the subfield of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of mutual coherence to prove $\ell^1/\ell^0$-equivalence is a technique often used in the field of compressed sensing (cs.IT), which is also mentioned in the abstract. The paper also discusses the use of SRC in image classification (cs.CV) and the use of a nonlinear transform to satisfy sparse recovery conditions (cs.NA). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of approximate equivalence in the success of SRC, which is a topic related to the robustness of machine learning algorithms (cs.SI).
